rows.name: question_text_happy
rows.value: Did you have any challenges when trying to introduce a consequence together?

rows.name: question_text_ok_sad
rows.value: What was difficult for you about introducing a consequence with your teen?

rows.name: text_challenge_1
rows.value: I got very angry when my teen broke the rule.

rows.name: reply_challenge_1
rows.value:
When we take a pause before responding, it helps us to calm down and respond better. 

Next time your teen makes you angry, try to take a pause first. Even a few deep breaths can make a big difference!

rows.name: text_challenge_2
rows.value: My teen got very angry with me after I gave the consequence.

rows.name: reply_challenge_2
rows.value:
When your teen gets angry, you might need to walk away until you are both calm. 

Check to make sure your consequence is fair and reasonable. Listen to your teen’s explanation, and make sure to give a “Safety Amnesty” if they broke a rule in order to stay safe.

rows.name: text_challenge_3
rows.value: I introduced the consequence without first discussing it with my teen.

rows.name: reply_challenge_3
rows.value: Can you make a consequence for if this happens again? When we establish a consequence together with our teens, the consequence will be more realistic, and our teens will be more willing and able to follow the rule.

rows.name: text_challenge_4
rows.value: I forgot to follow through with the consequence.

rows.name: reply_challenge_4
rows.value: We all make mistakes! The more consistent we are with our consequences, the more likely our children will choose to behave positively in the future.

rows.name: text_challenge_5
rows.value: Even with the consequence, my teen still does not follow the rule.

rows.name: reply_challenge_5
rows.value:
If your teen keeps breaking rules, you might need to spend more positive time with them. 

Try to keep going with your other goals  – like self-care, one-on-one time, and praise. All these skills will help your teen feel more loved and secure… and you less stressed!

rows.name: text_challenge_6
rows.value: We only created a negative consequence, not a positive consequence.

rows.name: reply_challenge_6
rows.value: It can be difficult to think of positive consequences sometimes. Positive consequences will encourage your teen to take more responsibility, and you will see the difference!

rows.name: text_challenge_7
rows.value: My teen suggested being hit as a negative consequence.

rows.name: reply_challenge_7
rows.value:
Teens can be used to seeing hitting as the only possible consequence for breaking rules. 

Brainstorm some calm consequences with them that could help them understand that they have done something wrong. These will be more effective and will set positive examples!
